intro: Hicorius arkansana, commonly known as the Arkansas hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and wetlands. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Hicorius arkansana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
